newsitem.title: USA: Air Jamaica adds third weekly Miami freighter.
newsitem.headline: Air Jamaica adds third weekly Miami freighter.

text.p: Air Jamaica, after beginning its freighter service just this year, has added a third weekly freighter from Miami International Airport to the island, a company executive said Thursday.
"We are the number one, preferred cargo carrier to Jamaica," Air Jamaica's Miami cargo manager Orville Hart told Reuters in an interview.
The third weekly Douglas DC-8 flight brings Air Jamaica's weekly lift from Miami to 750,000 pounds. The airline flies 42 passenger flights weekly from Miami, Hart said.

Southbound, Air Jamaica carries a variety of goods including tractor parts, computers, hatching eggs and in a reversal for Miami carriers, perishables. Jamaican production of fruits, vegetables and seafoods cannot keep up with the demand from the tourism industry, Hart said.
Air Jamaica carries a lot of so-called "807 garments" both ways, Hart said. These are garments cut in the United States, assembled elsewhere and returned to the U.S. for sale.

Air Jamaica ranked 28th in the amount of international cargo carried through Miami in 1995, handling 11,421 tons, according to statistics compiled by the Dade County Aviation Department. - -Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
